name: Applicable Date Range Guide
title: Applicable Date Range Guide
body:
When your organization undergoes an audit, the auditor may need to verify that a sample of evidence was in effect during a specific time frame. For example, it may be required that your employees take compliance training every year. This means the compliance training would only be applicable for one year. To record this time frame in your KCM GRC platform, users can enter an Applicable Date Range for the evidence that they submit for control tasks. 

Note:This feature is currently being tested by select customers, but it will be widely available soon. If you would like to be part of our early access testing, please contact your Customer Success Manager.

The Applicable Date Range feature is available to accounts that have enabled Effective Date Range (EDR) for task schedules. To check if your account has EDR enabled, navigate to your Account Settings and see the Allow Effective Date Range in task schedules field.

This guide explains how to submit an applicable date range for evidence and it explains the areas of your platform where you can view the evidence's applicable date range.

How Do I Add an Applicable Date Range to Evidence?

You will apply an Applicable Date Range (ADR) to your evidence from the View Task page. You can apply an ADR when you are adding new evidence or when you are updating existing evidence. 

Note:To see the full instructions for submitting evidence, see our How to Monitor and Complete Tasks article.

The Applicable Date Range field is found at the bottom of the Create Link, Update Link, Upload Document, or Update Document window. Follow the steps below to add an ADR:

  1. Click the Applicable Date Range field to open the date picker window that you will use to select your date range.
  2. Click the beginning date in your applicable date range. Use the arrows at the top of the calendar to scroll through the months.
    Tip:You can click on the name of the month and year at the top of the calendar to quickly navigate to the month and year that you are looking for.
  3. Hover over the ending date in your applicable date range. Before clicking, you can look at the Applicable Date Range field to ensure you are selecting the desired date range, as shown below.
  4. Click the end date for your time frame to close the date picker.
  5. Click the Update button at the bottom right-hand corner of the window. This button may have a different name depending on which window you are adding the ADR to. 

Where Can I See Applicable Date Ranges in My Account? 

There are several areas of your account where Account Administrators and, when applicable, Scope Administrator and Auditor users can view the Applicable Date Range (ADR) for the evidence in your account. See the drop-down menus below for details.

Note:To learn more about what Auditor users can view in your platform, please see our Guide for Auditors. To learn how to add scope access for Auditors and Scope Administrators, see Allowed Scopes under the Creating User Accounts section of our How to Create and Manage User Accounts article.

  • The Supporting Evidence area of the View Task page shows the date range under the Applicable Date Range column.If an applicable date range has not been applied to the evidence, you will see a dash (-) in this column.

    Tip:In the search field under Applicable Date Range, you can select a date to filter the column results. These results will only show evidence with an applicable date range that includes the date you've selected. When using this filter, evidence without an applicable date range will not be shown.

  • The Evidence tab on the View Control page shows the date range under the Applicable Date Range column.If an applicable date range has not been applied to the evidence, you will see a dash (-) in this column.

    Tip:In the search field under Applicable Date Range, you can select a date to filter the column results. These results will only show evidence with an applicable date range that includes the date you've selected. When using this filter, evidence without an applicable date range will not be shown.

  • The Evidence tab on the View Scope page shows the date range under the Applicable Date Range column.If an applicable date range has not been applied to the evidence, you will see a dash (-) in this column.

    Tip:In the search field under Applicable Date Range, you can select a date to filter the column results. These results will only show evidence with an applicable date range that includes the date you've selected. When using this filter, evidence without an applicable date range will not be shown.

  • The All tab on the Documents page shows the date range under the Applicable Date Range column.If an applicable date range has not been applied to the evidence, you will see a dash (-) in this column.

    The Evidence tab on the Documents page shows this date range under the Applicable Date Range column.If an applicable date range has not been applied to the evidence, you will see a dash (-) in this column.

    Tip:In the search field under Applicable Date Range, you can select a date to filter the column results. These results will only show evidence with an applicable date range that includes the date you've selected. When using this filter, evidence without an applicable date range will not be shown.

  • When you click on a task in the Detailed Compliance Report, the Task Information window will include the Applicable Date Range column under the Supporting Evidence area. If an applicable date range has not been applied to the evidence, you will see a dash (-) in this column.

    To learn more about the Detailed Compliance Report, see our Metrics Reporting Guide.

  • When you click on a horizontal bar in the Scope Tasks Gantt chart, the Task Information window will include the Applicable Date Range column under the Supporting Evidence area. If an applicable date range has not been applied to the evidence, you will see a dash (-) in this column.

    To learn more about the Scope Tasks Gantt chart, see our Metrics Reporting Guide.

images.alt:
The image displays a section of a settings configuration screen titled "Effective Date Range Settings."

**Contextual Text:**
Below the title, explanatory text states: "When creating a task schedule for a control, if you utilize Effective Date Range you are choosing to show the time period that is covered by the task. Using Effective Date Range is generally not necessary or recommended for most use cases."

**UI Element:**
A specific configuration option is highlighted by a thick orange border:
*   **Label:** **Allow Effective Date Range in task schedules** (Bold text).
*   **Control Type:** Toggle switch (slider).
*   **State:** The toggle switch is set to the **ON** position, indicated by the control showing green with the circular switch on the right side.
images.context: he Allow Effective Date Range in task schedules field.

images.alt:
This image depicts a section of a data entry form with an active calendar date picker widget.

**Form Context and Fields:**
The form structure displays four labeled fields:
1.  **Link \*** (Required): Shows a red validation error message immediately below the input box: "Hyperlink must include a protocol (https://, http:".
2.  **Version:** Standard text input.
3.  **Description:** Multi-line text area.
4.  **Applicable Date Range:** Features an information icon (i) next to the label. The input field displays the placeholder text: "Select a date range from the calendar...".

**Calendar Widget Details:**
A date picker pop-up is active, centered over the form fields, positioned above and pointing toward the "Applicable Date Range" field. The header displays the current view: **February 2021**, flanked by navigation arrows. The calendar grid shows all 28 days of the month, starting the week on Sunday (S).

**User Interaction:**
A black mouse cursor is visible, hovering over or pointing toward the right side of the "Applicable Date Range" input field.

**Footer:**
The bottom of the form displays two action buttons: **Cancel** (secondary button) and **Create** (primary, green button).
images.context: eld to open the date picker window that you will use to select your date range.

images.alt:
The image captures a fragment of a user interface form showing the completion of a date range selection process via an interactive calendar popover.

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Form Fields:** Three standard input fields are partially visible: **Version**, **Description**, and **Applicable Date Range**.
2.  **Date Range Field:** The **Applicable Date Range** field is the focus, displaying the selected data: `01/01/2020 - 12/31/2020`. This data field is emphasized by an overlaying orange oval. An information icon ($\text{i}$) is adjacent to the label.
3.  **Calendar Popover:** A calendar widget is displayed, showing the month **December 2020** with navigation arrows ($\langle$, $\rangle$).
4.  **Date Selection:** All dates (1 through 31) within December 2020 are highlighted in blue, indicating they are part of the currently selected range.
5.  **Active Input:** A hand cursor icon is positioned over the date **31**, which is outlined in blue, confirming the action of selecting or finalizing the end date (`12/31/2020`) for the range.
images.context: ld to ensure you are selecting the desired date range, as shown below.

images.alt:
This image displays a user interface component for managing a date range setting.

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Label:** The component is labeled in bold text as "Applicable Date Range," followed by an interactive information icon (circled 'i').
2.  **Input Field:** A rectangular input box is displayed below the label. This field contains the current value, likely indicating a pre-selected or editable date range.
3.  **Data Value:** The date range displayed within the input field is **"01/01/2021 - 12/31/2021."**
4.  **Action Buttons:** Two command buttons are aligned to the bottom right of the component:
    *   **Cancel:** A secondary button (light gray/white background).
    *   **Update:** The primary action button (bright green background), which is highlighted by a focus indicator (an orange circle in this image) indicating the action to be performed after changes are made.
images.context: ay have a different name depending on which window you are adding the ADR to.

images.alt:
The image displays a list management interface for "Supporting Evidence."

**Interface Elements:**

1.  **Header and Actions:** The title is "Supporting Evidence," accompanied by an informational icon and a black status badge reading "File Upload or DocuLink Required." Two primary action buttons are located on the top right: "Upload Document" and "Create Link."
2.  **Data Table Structure:** The list is presented in a table format with sortable column headers and integrated search boxes (placeholder text: "Search...") beneath each header. The columns are:
    *   Name
    *   Created By
    *   Date Created
    *   Applicable Date Range (marked with an informational icon 'i')
3.  **Data Records (2 total records shown):**
    *   **Record 1:** Name: "Access Control List 2021"; Created By: "Jane Doe"; Date Created: "January 20, 2021"; Applicable Date Range: "January 1, 2021 - December 31, 2021." Associated actions include a cloud/download icon, an edit (pencil) icon, and a delete (trashcan) icon.
    *   **Record 2:** Name: "Access Control screenshots"; Created By: "Site Admin"; Date Created: "January 19, 2021"; Applicable Date Range: "January 1, 2020 - December 31, 2020." Associated actions include a link (chain) icon, an edit (pencil) icon, and a delete (trashcan) icon.
4.  **Summary:** The table footer confirms "2 record(s)" are displayed.
images.context: not been applied to the evidence, you will see a dash (-) in this column.

images.alt:
The image displays a section of a web application interface focused on data management, specifically within the **Evidence** tab (indicated as active/selected).

**Context and Navigation:**
The top navigation bar contains tabs for workflow management: `Task Schedules`, `Tasks`, `Evidence` (active), `Documents`, `Requirements`, and `Risks`.

**Data Grid Structure:**
The main area is a searchable data grid presenting listed evidence items. Columns are defined by the following headers, which also feature sort/filter indicators:
1.  **Name**
2.  **Date Created**
3.  **Applicable Date Range** (Includes an informational icon `i`).
4.  **Actions**

Search input fields labeled "Search..." are located directly below the first three column headers, allowing users to filter the content.

**Data Content (Example Rows):**
The table displays at least three entries:
*   **Row 1:** Name: `Access Control List 2020`. Date Created: `February 22, 2021`. Applicable Date Range: `-`. Actions: Link icon and Edit icon.
*   **Row 2:** Name: `Access Control List 2021`. Date Created: `January 20, 2021`. Applicable Date Range: `January 1, 2021 - December 31, 2021`. Actions: Cloud Download icon and Edit icon.
*   **Row 3:** Name: `Access Control screenshots`. Date Created: `January 19, 2021`. Applicable Date Range: `January 1, 2020 - December 31, 2020`. Actions: Link icon and Edit icon.

**Focus Area:**
The column **Applicable Date Range** and its corresponding row data are visually emphasized by a bounding orange rectangle, highlighting how date ranges (e.g., `January 1, 2021 - December 31, 2021`) are presented for associated evidence.

images.alt:
This image depicts a segment of a web application interface focused on **Evidence** management within a compliance or control system.

**UI Context and Navigation:**
The primary navigation bar shows "Evidence" as the active tab, indicated by a visual highlight (and an orange oval overlay in the original image). Other visible navigation links include Overview, Requirements, Controls, Tasks, and Members. A global control on the top right sets the "Page Size" to 10 via a dropdown selector.

**Data Grid Structure:**
The main content is a filterable data grid displaying records, likely representing evidence files or documentation.

*   **Column Headers:** The grid includes sortable column headers: "Name," "Control Name," "View Task," "Date Created," and "Applicable Date Range."
*   **Filtering:** Search input fields labeled "Search..." are present directly beneath the Name, Control Name, Date Created, and Applicable Date Range headers, indicating inline filtering capability.

**Highlighted Element (Applicable Date Range):**
The column "Applicable Date Range" is specifically highlighted with an orange border. The column header includes an information icon (**i**) next to the title.

**Data Samples:**
The grid displays several rows, demonstrating the structure of evidence records:

| Column Header | Row 1 Example | Row 2 Example |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Name** | Access Control List 2020 | Access Control List 2021 |
| **Control Name** | Access control (Link) | Access control (Link) |
| **View Task** | Blue "Task" button | Blue "Task" button |
| **Date Created** | February 22, 2021 | January 20, 2021 |
| **Applicable Date Range** | - | January 1, 2021 - December 31, 2021 |
| **Actions (Implicit Column)** | Link icon, Edit icon | Cloud/Download icon, Link icon, Edit icon |

images.alt:
This image displays a data grid within a document or evidence management system interface, specifically focused on viewing compiled documents.

**1. Navigation and Context:**
The interface features a primary navigation bar displaying document categories. The **"All"** tab is currently active (highlighted by an underline and explicitly circled in the hint). Other available categories include "Evidence," "Policies," "Vendor Documents," and "Control Documents."

**2. Controls:**
In the upper right corner, a configuration control is present: **"Page Size:"** set to **"100"** via a dropdown selection menu.

**3. Data Grid Structure:**
The main content is a sortable data table with individual search fields directly below each column header for filtering. The columns are:
*   **Name** (Sortable)
*   **Date Created** (Sortable)
*   **Applicable Date Range** (Includes an informational 'i' icon)
*   **Actions**

**4. Data Examples (Rows):**
The table lists document entries with corresponding metadata.

*   An entry named **"Access Control List 2021"** (created January 20, 2021) explicitly defines an applicable date range of **"January 1, 2021 - December 31, 2021."** The associated actions column displays both a cloud download icon and a chain link icon.
*   The entry below it, **"Access Control screenshots"** (created January 19, 2021), specifies the applicable date range as **"January 1, 2020 - December 31, 2020."** The actions column displays a chain link icon.
*   The first three visible entries (e.g., "Access Control List 2020," "Security Awareness Training...") lack an explicit applicable date range (represented by a dash) and typically show only the chain link icon in the Actions column.

images.alt:
This image displays a data grid view within a web application, specifically focused on the **Evidence** tab of a multi-tabbed interface.

**I. Interface Context and Navigation:**
*   The primary navigation header shows five visible tabs: "All", **"Evidence" (active/selected)**, "Policies", "Vendor Documents", and "Control Documents."
*   In the top right, a **Page Size** control is present, currently set to **100**.

**II. Data Grid Structure and Controls:**
*   The page features a searchable and sortable data grid.
*   The main column headers are: **Name**, **Control Name**, **Task**, **Date Created**, and **Applicable Date Range**.
*   Search/filter input fields are present directly beneath the first four column headers. The "Applicable Date Range" column header includes an informational 'i' icon.
*   Sorting indicators (up/down arrows) are present on the "Name," "Control Name," and "Date Created" headers.

**III. Data Row Examples and Elements:**
*   Each row represents an evidence record and begins with an expandable disclosure indicator (>).
*   **Name and Control Name** fields typically display clickable blue text entries (e.g., "Access Control List 2020," "Access control").
*   The **Task** column features a constant bright blue button labeled **"Task"** for every entry.
*   **Date Created** lists timestamps (e.g., "February 22, 2021").
*   **Applicable Date Range:**
    *   Specific date ranges are shown, such as **"January 1, 2021 - December 31, 2021"** and **"January 1, 2020 - December 31, 2020"** (these rows are visually emphasized by an orange box).
    *   The rightmost section of this column contains action icons: a link icon (chain), and an edit icon (pencil). Some entries also feature a download icon (cloud with arrow).

images.alt:
This image displays a compliance or task management interface titled **"Task Information."**

The primary content section is labeled **"Access control"** and includes two status indicators in the upper right: **"Closed Late"** and **"Awaiting Approval."**

1.  **Control Description Panel:** A blue header panel provides a detailed **"Control Description"** regarding limiting access to company computers and network services to authorized users and devices.
2.  **Supporting Evidence Table:** Below the description, a section titled **"Supporting Evidence"** contains a data table. The table columns are **Name**, **Email**, **Date Created**, **Applicable Date Range**, and an uncaptioned column displaying action/status icons (Cloud upload, Link).
3.  **Data Entries and Highlight:** The table displays three entries. The second column, **Applicable Date Range**, is visually highlighted, showing specific date ranges for the first two entries (e.g., "January 01, 2021 - December 31, 2021"). The associated evidence items include documents like **"Access Control List 2021"** and **"Access Control screenshots."**
4.  **Pagination:** The table footer indicates **"Showing 1 to 3 of 3 entries"** and provides standard pagination controls (**Previous**, current page **1** selected, **Next**).

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface for reviewing **Task Information** within a compliance or task management system.

**Header and Status:**
The primary page title is "Task Information." The header includes actions: "Open In New Window" and a close icon. The specific task, titled "Access control," displays two status indicators: a green "Closed Late" pill and a light blue "Awaiting Approval" pill.

**Control Description Section:**
A blue banner titled "Control Description" provides context: "Control who can use company computers and who can log on to the company network. Limit the services and devices, like printers, that can be accessed by company computers. Set up your system so that unauthorized users and devices cannot get on the company network."

**Supporting Evidence Data Table:**
Below the description, a "Supporting Evidence" section (marked by a blue banner and a document icon) displays a sortable data table detailing linked evidence. The table columns are: **Name**, **Email**, **Date Created**, and **Applicable Date Range**.

**Data Table Entries:**
Key entries include:
1.  **Access Control List 2021**, submitted by `compliancemanagement@knowbe4.com` on Jan 20, 2021. The **Applicable Date Range** is **January 01, 2021 - December 31, 2021**. A cloud icon is present in the action column.
2.  **Access Control screenshots**, submitted by `laurena@knowbe4.com` on Jan 19, 2021. The **Applicable Date Range** is **January 01, 2020 - December 31, 2020**. A chain link icon is present.
3.  The *Applicable Date Range* column for the first two entries is emphasized by an orange bounding box.
